required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 8-Week PK/PD Atorvastatin Study In Children And Adolescents With Heterozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia
clinical_study.official_title: A 8-Week, Open-Label, Phase 1 Study To Evaluate Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, Safety And Tolerability Of Atorvastatin In Children And Adolescents With Heterozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, safety and tolerability of atorvastatin in children and adolescents with heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia

primary_outcome.measure: Parent-metabolite Population Pharmacokinetic (PK) Model for Atorvastatin and Its Metabolites: Atorvastatin Apparent Clearance (CL/F)
primary_outcome.description: Parent-metabolite population PK model built using sparse blood samples from both Tanner Stage 1 and Tanner Stage 2+. Blood sampling times: Weeks 2 and 6: single sample between 4 and 12 hours postdose; Weeks 4 and 8: predose, 1 hour, and 2 hours postdose. Plasma samples were analyzed for atorvastatin and active hydroxyacid metabolite (o-hydroxyatorvastatin) concentrations using a validated, sensitive, and specific high-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric method. Data presented are the result of the model used.

primary_outcome.measure: Parent-metabolite Population Pharmacokinetic (PK) Model for Atorvastatin and Its Metabolites: Apparent Volume of Distribution of the Central Compartment (Vc/F)
primary_outcome.description: Parent-metabolite population PK model built using sparse blood samples from Tanner Stages 1 and 2+. Sampling times: Weeks 2 + 6: single sample between 4 -12 hours postdose; Weeks 4 + 8: predose, 1 + 2 hours postdose. Plasma samples analyzed for atorvastatin and active hydroxyacid metabolite (o-hydroxyatorvastatin) concentrations using validated, sensitive, specific high-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric method. Vc/F value based on 70 kg body weight. Parameter estimation uncertainty (95% CI) by non-parametric bootstrap analysis. Data presented are result of model used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Pharmacodynamic Responses of Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) measured in millimoles per liter (mmol/L); assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Pharmacodynamic Responses of Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [LDL-C at observation minus LDL-C at Week 0] divided by LDL-C at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Total Cholesterol (TC)
secondary_outcome.description: Total Cholesterol measured in millimoles per liter (mmol/L); assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Cholesterol (TC)
secondary_outcome.description: Total cholesterol (TC): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [TC at observation minus TC at Week 0] divided by TC at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Triglycerides (TG)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in triglycerides measured in millimoles per liter (mmol/L); assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Triglycerides (TG)
secondary_outcome.description: Triglycerides (TG): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [TG at observation minus TG at Week 0] divided by TG at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol measured in millimoles per liter (mmol/L); assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: High-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C): percent (%) change by treatment over time = [HDL-C at observation minus HDL-C at Week 0] divided by HDL-C at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Apolipoprotein A-1 (Apo A-1)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Apolipoprotein A-1 measured in grams per liter (g/L); assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Apolipoprotein A-1 (Apo A-1)
secondary_outcome.description: Apolipoprotein A-1 (Apo A-1): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [Apo A-1 at observation minus Apo A-1 at Week 0] divided by Apo A-1 at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Apolipoprotein B (Apo B)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Apolipoprotein B measured in grams per liter (g/L); assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Apolipoprotein B (Apo B)
secondary_outcome.description: Apolipoprotein B (Apo B): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [Apo B at observation minus Apo B at Week 0] divided by Apo B at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Very Low-density Lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in very low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C) measured in millimoles per liter (mmol/L). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Very Low-density Lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Very low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [VLDL-C at observation minus VLDL-C at Week 0] divided by VLDL-C at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Flow-Mediated Dilatation at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) = (max minus baseline diameter divided by baseline diameter) x 100%. Standardized image acquisition: brachial artery images recorded for one minute at rest, blood pressure cuff inflated to 250 mm Hg for 5 minutes with brachial artery imaged continuously throughout cuff inflation, cuff released to produce reactive hyperaemia and the brachial artery imaged continuously for 3 minutes after release. Total duration of measurement approximately 25 minutes. Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Flow-Mediated Dilatation at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Brachial Flow-Mediated Dilatation (FMD) = (max minus baseline diameter divided by baseline diameter) x 100%.

arm_group.description: 6-10 years will be administered with atorvastatin tablet formulation with initial doses based on age cohort.
10-17 years will be administered 10-mg daily dose of atorvastatin tablet formulation.

intervention.description: 6-10 years Tanner Stage 1 will be administered 5-mg daily dose of an atorvastatin pediatric tablet formulation. Dose may be doubled if subjects have not attained target LDL (<3.35 mmol/L) after 4-week treatment.

10-17 years Tanner Stage 2 will be administered 10-mg daily dose of atorvastatin tablet formulation. Dose may be doubled if subjects have not attained target LDL (<3.35 mmol/L) after 4-week treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Genetically confirmed heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HeFH) with LDL greater or equal 4 mmol/L at baseline
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence or history of clinically significant diseases, homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (FH)

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled at 3 medical centers and participated in the study between 02 December 2008 and 13 May 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Forty-five subjects were screened, and 39 subjects were assigned to study treatment.

group.title: Atorvastatin (5 mg, 10 mg): Tanner Stage 1
group.description: Age 6 - 10 years, at Tanner Stage 1. Initial dose 5 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 10 mg/day if target low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) was not attained.

group.title: Atorvastatin (10 mg, 20 mg): Tanner Stage 2+
group.description: Age 10 - 17 years, at Tanner Stage 2+. Initial dose 10 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 20 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained.

group.title: Atorvastatin (5 mg, 10 mg): Tanner Stage 1
group.description: Initial dose 5 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 10 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

group.title: Atorvastatin (10 mg, 20 mg): Tanner Stage 2+
group.description: Initial dose 10 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 20 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender

outcome.title: Parent-metabolite Population Pharmacokinetic (PK) Model for Atorvastatin and Its Metabolites: Atorvastatin Apparent Clearance (CL/F)
outcome.description: Parent-metabolite population PK model built using sparse blood samples from both Tanner Stage 1 and Tanner Stage 2+. Blood sampling times: Weeks 2 and 6: single sample between 4 and 12 hours postdose; Weeks 4 and 8: predose, 1 hour, and 2 hours postdose. Plasma samples were analyzed for atorvastatin and active hydroxyacid metabolite (o-hydroxyatorvastatin) concentrations using a validated, sensitive, and specific high-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric method. Data presented are the result of the model used.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) concentration population: all enrolled and treated subjects who had ≥ 1 PK concentration assessed. Active hydroxyacid metabolite p-hydroxyatorvastatin was not included in the model as originally planned as > 80% of samples were below detectable level at the doses used in this trial.

group.title: Atorvastatin (5 mg, 10 mg): Tanner Stage 1
group.description: Initial dose 5 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 10 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

group.title: Atorvastatin (10 mg, 20 mg): Tanner Stage 2+
group.description: Initial dose 10 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 20 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

measure.title: Parent-metabolite Population Pharmacokinetic (PK) Model for Atorvastatin and Its Metabolites: Atorvastatin Apparent Clearance (CL/F)
measure.description: Parent-metabolite population PK model built using sparse blood samples from both Tanner Stage 1 and Tanner Stage 2+. Blood sampling times: Weeks 2 and 6: single sample between 4 and 12 hours postdose; Weeks 4 and 8: predose, 1 hour, and 2 hours postdose. Plasma samples were analyzed for atorvastatin and active hydroxyacid metabolite (o-hydroxyatorvastatin) concentrations using a validated, sensitive, and specific high-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric method. Data presented are the result of the model used.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) concentration population: all enrolled and treated subjects who had ≥ 1 PK concentration assessed. Active hydroxyacid metabolite p-hydroxyatorvastatin was not included in the model as originally planned as > 80% of samples were below detectable level at the doses used in this trial.

analysis.groups_desc: Atorvastatin apparent clearance (CL/F) was described as a function of body weight using an allometric equation. The estimated parameter given is an extrapolation of the model for participants who weigh 70 kg.
analysis.param_type: Atorvastatin CL/F based on 70 kg BW

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Pharmacodynamic Responses of Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C)
outcome.description: Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) measured in millimoles per liter (mmol/L); assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.
outcome.population: Pharmacodynamic (PD) analysis population: all enrolled subjects who received ≥ 1 dose of study drug and had ≥ 1 PD parameter measurement.

measure.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Very Low-density Lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C)
measure.description: Change from baseline in very low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C) measured in millimoles per liter (mmol/L). Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Very Low-density Lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C)
outcome.description: Very low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [VLDL-C at observation minus VLDL-C at Week 0] divided by VLDL-C at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

group.title: Stayed at 5 mg: Tanner Stage 1
group.description: Atorvastatin 5 mg/day

group.title: Titrated to 10 mg: Tanner Stage 1
group.description: Atorvastatin: initial dose 5 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose was doubled to 10 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

group.title: Stayed at 10 mg: Tanner Stage 2+
group.description: Atorvastatin 10 mg/day

group.title: Titrated to 20 mg: Tanner Stage 2+
group.description: Atorvastatin: initial dose 10 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose was doubled to 20 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Very Low-density Lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C)
measure.description: Very low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol (VLDL-C): percent (%) change from baseline by treatment over time = [VLDL-C at observation minus VLDL-C at Week 0] divided by VLDL-C at Week 0 * 100. Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast [optional at Weeks 2 and 6]).

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Flow-Mediated Dilatation at Week 8
outcome.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) = (max minus baseline diameter divided by baseline diameter) x 100%. Standardized image acquisition: brachial artery images recorded for one minute at rest, blood pressure cuff inflated to 250 mm Hg for 5 minutes with brachial artery imaged continuously throughout cuff inflation, cuff released to produce reactive hyperaemia and the brachial artery imaged continuously for 3 minutes after release. Total duration of measurement approximately 25 minutes. Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.
outcome.population: PD analysis population. Flow-mediated dilation (FMD) was measured at centers with established FMD facilities.

group.description: Atorvastatin 5 mg/day

group.title: Titrated to 10 mg: Tanner Stage 1

measure.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) = (max minus baseline diameter divided by baseline diameter) x 100%. Standardized image acquisition: brachial artery images recorded for one minute at rest, blood pressure cuff inflated to 250 mm Hg for 5 minutes with brachial artery imaged continuously throughout cuff inflation, cuff released to produce reactive hyperaemia and the brachial artery imaged continuously for 3 minutes after release. Total duration of measurement approximately 25 minutes. Change from baseline = value at observation minus baseline value.
measure.population: PD analysis population. Flow-mediated dilation (FMD) was measured at centers with established FMD facilities.

outcome.description: Brachial Flow-Mediated Dilatation (FMD) = (max minus baseline diameter divided by baseline diameter) x 100%.
outcome.population: PD analysis population. Flow-mediated dilation (FMD) was measured at centers with established FMD facilities.

group.title: Titrated to 10 mg: Tanner Stage 1

group.title: Titrated to 20 mg: Tanner Stage 2+

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Flow-Mediated Dilatation at Week 8

measure.population: PD analysis population. Flow-mediated dilation (FMD) was measured at centers with established FMD facilities.

outcome.title: Parent-metabolite Population Pharmacokinetic (PK) Model for Atorvastatin and Its Metabolites: Apparent Volume of Distribution of the Central Compartment (Vc/F)
outcome.description: Parent-metabolite population PK model built using sparse blood samples from Tanner Stages 1 and 2+. Sampling times: Weeks 2 + 6: single sample between 4 -12 hours postdose; Weeks 4 + 8: predose, 1 + 2 hours postdose. Plasma samples analyzed for atorvastatin and active hydroxyacid metabolite (o-hydroxyatorvastatin) concentrations using validated, sensitive, specific high-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric method. Vc/F value based on 70 kg body weight. Parameter estimation uncertainty (95% CI) by non-parametric bootstrap analysis. Data presented are result of model used.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) concentration population: all enrolled and treated subjects who had ≥ 1 PK concentration assessed. Active hydroxyacid metabolite p-hydroxyatorvastatin was not included in the model as originally planned as > 80% of samples were below detectable level at the doses used in this trial.

group.title: Atorvastatin (5 mg, 10 mg, 20 mg): Tanner Stages 1 and 2+
group.description: Tanner Stage 1: Initial dose 5 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 10 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated; Tanner Stage 2+: Initial dose 10 mg/day through Week 4; after Week 4 dose may have been doubled to 20 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

measure.title: Parent-metabolite Population Pharmacokinetic (PK) Model for Atorvastatin and Its Metabolites: Apparent Volume of Distribution of the Central Compartment (Vc/F)
measure.description: Parent-metabolite population PK model built using sparse blood samples from Tanner Stages 1 and 2+. Sampling times: Weeks 2 + 6: single sample between 4 -12 hours postdose; Weeks 4 + 8: predose, 1 + 2 hours postdose. Plasma samples analyzed for atorvastatin and active hydroxyacid metabolite (o-hydroxyatorvastatin) concentrations using validated, sensitive, specific high-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric method. Vc/F value based on 70 kg body weight. Parameter estimation uncertainty (95% CI) by non-parametric bootstrap analysis. Data presented are result of model used.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) concentration population: all enrolled and treated subjects who had ≥ 1 PK concentration assessed. Active hydroxyacid metabolite p-hydroxyatorvastatin was not included in the model as originally planned as > 80% of samples were below detectable level at the doses used in this trial.

group.title: All Subjects (5 mg, 10 mg): Tanner Stage 1
group.description: Atorvastatin: subjects who stayed at initial dose of 5 mg/day for duration of study and subjects who titrated after Week 4 to 10 mg/day if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

group.title: All Subjects (10 mg, 20 mg): Tanner Stage 2+
group.description: Atorvastatin: subjects who stayed at initial dose of 10 mg/day for duration of study and subjects who titrated to 20 mg/day after Week 4 if target LDL-C was not attained and study drug was well tolerated.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
